[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/references.rs] [Function: BorrowEdges::remap_refs()] [Large map iteration] Does iterating and remapping large BTreeMaps cause excessive gas consumption? Is there a maximum graph size enforced? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/references.rs] [Struct: BorrowEdgeSet] [Overflow threshold attack] By keeping edge count at exactly MAX_EDGE_SET_SIZE, can an attacker cause frequent overflows degrading performance? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/references.rs] [Overall] [Serialization integrity] If borrow graphs are serialized (e.g., for state snapshots), can deserialization create invalid graph states? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/references.rs] [Overall] [Bytecode verifier integration] Does the Move bytecode verifier use this borrow graph? Can verifier bugs allow invalid borrow patterns to pass? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/references.rs] [Overall] [Runtime enforcement] Is borrow checking purely static or are there runtime checks? Can malicious bytecode bypass static analysis? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/references.rs] [Overall] [Parallel execution impact] In Aptos's Block-STM parallel execution, can concurrent transactions corrupt shared borrow graph state? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/references.rs] [Overall] [Consensus divergence] Can non-deterministic behavior in borrow graph operations (e.g., HashMap ordering) cause validators to disagree on transaction validity? (Critical)
